snippet: Canadian researchers say they have located a ship from Sir John Franklin’s disastrous expedition in the 1840s to map the Northwest Passage, an area of new international interest as Arctic ice retreats.
abstract: Canadian researchers report that they have located a ship from Sir John Franklin's disastrous 1848 expedition to map the Northwest Passage, subject that has long been a point of national fascination; some critics say Prime Min Stephen Harper has seized upon it as a way to unite public opinion at a time of budget cuts and climate change.
lead_paragraph: Canadian researchers say they have located a ship from Sir John Franklin’s disastrous expedition in the 1840s to map the Northwest Passage, an area of new international interest as Arctic ice retreats.

headline.main: Canada Chases Down an Arctic Mystery, and Some See a Political Strategy
headline.print_headline: Canada Chases Down an Arctic Mystery, and Some See a Political Strategy
